Articles.Content:
I'm feeling all existential now. I don't like it. Why are there so many goosebumps, the universe will die AAAAHHH!

http://www.futuretimeline.net/
after reading the first page, i spotted 5 things that were bogus, this isnt worth my time.
Some things on there would be almost impossible to predict..

after reading the first page, i spotted 5 things that were bogus, this isnt worth my time.

Yes, I checked 2015, a mix of the obvious because its current trend or planned and the plain out bogus like recreating the mammoth.

the universe will die AAAAHHH!

Yeah, the heat death of the universe is one of the grimmer predictions of science. Given how immutable the Laws of Thermodynamics seem to be it seems like a pretty bombproof prediction, too. It's a stupidly long time away, but it always makes me a little bit sad to think about it.
Proton decay is what scares me. A distant civilization could extract energy from black holes but don't see why they would want to .
I wish I was born earlier now.
People in the 2050's will be laughing at this list, but oh well.
People in 2014 are laughing at this list.

People in the 2050's will be laughing at this list, but oh well.

They'll probably be too busy killing each other over food and water.

...or jobs. In the future people will have to fight in Thunderdome for the rare coveted chance to be a full-time burger flipper.

They'll probably be too busy killing each other over food and water.

...or jobs. In the future people will have to fight in Thunderdome for the rare coveted chance to be a full-time burger flipper.

Slight off topic, but at that point, I think much of society would have restructured itself into a more communist system so that jobs wouldn't be as essential, and superfluous jobs wouldn't be needed to keep the economy running. Buckminster Fuller's job quote.

And the obligatory relevant xkcd about the depressing future. Now with 50% more crowdsourcing!

Picture is obnoxiously large.
